data.title: Funeral Notices
data.meta_description: Find local and national death notices, funeral notices, obituaries, in memoriams, acknowledgements and family announcements including birthdays, births, anniversaries and marriages at funeral-notices.co.uk
data.text:
DELANEY BRAMLETTRock guitarist Delaney Bramlett, who worked with artists including George Harrison and Eric Clapton had died aged 69.The singer-songwriter-pr oducer enjoyed a career in music spanning more than 50 years and was responsible for classics such as "Let it Rain" and "Superstar", the latter recorded by Usher, Luther Vandross, Bette Midler, The Carpenters and Sonic Youth.Delaney died from complications from gallbladder surgery on 27 December 2008.He was born in Pontotoc, Mississippi, on 1 July 1939.After serving with the US Navy he moved to Los Angeles where he became an established singer and songwriterIn the late 1960s he found early fame in the rhythm and southern blues combo Delaney & Bonnie, which he formed with his first wife, Bonnie Lynn. They divorced in 1972.During his career he worked with Jimi Hendrix, Janis Joplin, John Lennon, Dave Mason, Billy Preston and the Everly Brothers. As a producer he was involved with Etta James and Elvin Bishop, and worked on Clapton's self-titled debut solo album in 1970.He was survived by his wife Susan Lanier-Bramlett, three daughters and a son.
